summary_points.title: Mixed Openings on Global Cues
summary_points.summary: Indian benchmark indices are set for a muted start, with Sensex and Nifty 50 likely to open flat or marginally higher amid mixed global signals. Gift Nifty trends around the 24,761.50 level indicate a slight premium to Nifty futures, reflecting cautious investor sentiment at the open.

summary_points.title: Rebound Rally Snaps Losing Streak
summary_points.summary: After a three-session slump, Sensex and Nifty 50 surged by 554.84 points (0.70%) and 198.20 points (0.81%) respectively, closing at 80,364.49 and 24,625.05. Broad-based buying across sectors propelled this strong comeback, lifting markets back above key technical thresholds.

summary_points.title: Late-Session Profit Booking Trims Gains
summary_points.summary: Benchmarks surrendered morning gains to end in the red on profit‐booking in the fag‐end of the session, with Sensex easing by 207 points (0.26%) to 80,157.88 and Nifty dipping 45 points (0.18%) to 24,579.60. Weak global trends and cautious flows weighed on sentiment toward the close.

summary_points.title: Mid and Small Caps Lead Market Outperformance
summary_points.summary: While heavyweight banks and auto names acted as drags on the main indices, midcap and smallcap segments outperformed, rising 0.27% and 0.64% respectively. Investors rotated into broader‐market plays seeking growth opportunities amid sectoral rebalancing.

summary_points.title: Geopolitical Trade Tensions Influence Outlook
summary_points.summary: Potential US tariffs, shifting India-US relations, and trade discussions at the SCO summit are injecting uncertainty into market sentiment. Experts caution that unpredictable global policies and continued FII outflows could cap upside momentum for Indian equities.

summary_points.title: Technical Charts Signal Cautious Upside
summary_points.summary: Market charts display mixed signals: intraday reversal patterns and bullish daily candles point to a near‐term pullback continuation, yet weekly charts bear long bearish formations. This technical divergence suggests limited upside and underscores the need for caution.

articles.title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq sink as Treasury yields jump amid tariff, Fed uncertainty
articles.snippet: Wall Street is prepping for a tense opening to September trading with tariff legal issues and concerns about the Fed's integrity on deck.

articles.snippet: Mobius expressed his trust in the Indian market amid global uncertainties, including ongoing conflicts and new tariff challenges. He asserted that India’s rapid economic growth, stable development and substantial domestic market make it more attractive than any other country in the world. top_performers.explanation: Defensive consumer‐staples names drew buying interest amid market volatility.
Better ad‐revenue expectations supported gains in media stocks.
Stabilising commodity prices and demand prospects lifted metal shares.

underperformers.explanation: Profit booking hit private‐lender stocks ahead of quarterly results.
Risk‐off sentiment weighed on broader financial‐services names.
Large banks saw end‐of‐session profit taking after recent gains.

gainers.reason: One of the tyre stocks singled out for gains in the session, rising on broad market buying.
Cited as one of the strongest supports on the Nifty amid weak global cues and end‐of‐day swings.
Mentioned among the top stocks providing support to benchmarks on the day.

losers.reason: Flagged as a top drag on the Nifty, weighed by expiry‐related volatility and profit booking.
Also among the biggest drags on the index, hit by session‐end profit taking.
Listed as a heavy-weight that underperformed amid fag-end profit booking.

market_drivers.summary: Indian markets extended their rally on Tuesday, with the Sensex up over 200 points and the Nifty reclaiming the 24,600-plus mark, driven by optimism around imminent GST rationalisation and robust Q1 GDP growth. Heavyweight Reliance Industries led sectoral gains, while auto and IT stocks outperformed, buoyed by hopes of a US Fed rate cut and stable currency flows. Healthy domestic institutional inflows offset recent FII selling triggered by US tariff tensions, as traders awaited the GST Council’s decisions to cement consumption demand amid shifting global geopolitics and mounting export headwinds.
